Key Arguments: The proposed bill should be wholly rejected.
Top-down, heavy-handed government approaches degrade public trust in institutions.
The bill will decrease trust in the government and foster disunity.
The exemption of government-authorized content from the bill is concerning and suggests a double standard.
Notable Quotes: This is the kind of proposal that someone might expect under a Soviet-style regime. Not in Australia.
Such contempt for the Australian people the government is supposed to serve must be condemned.
